sources.title: Night Tide (1961)
sources.description: Dennis Hopper as a sailor who falls for a girl who works as a mermaid in a sideshow. Is she human or really a sea creature?

sources.title: Night Tide
sources.description: Title: Night Tide Summary: A young sailor falls in love with a mysterious woman, performing as a mermaid at the local carnival. He soon comes to suspect the girl might be a real mermaid, who draws men to a watery death during the full moon. Directed by: Curtis Harrington Actors: Dennis Hopper, Linda Lawson, Gavin Muir Production Company: Phoenix Films Release Date: 17 September 1965 (Mexico) Aspect Ratio: 1.66 : 1 On leave in a shore side town, Johnny becomes interested in a young dark haired woman. They meet and he learns that she plays a mermaid in the local carnival. After strange occurrences, Johnny begins to believe that she may actually be a real mermaid that habitually kills during the cycle of the full moon.

sources.title: Night Tide (1961)
sources.description: Johnny (Dennis Hopper) is on shore leave and meets Mora (Linda Lawson) whom he believes is a mermaid and kills during the full moon. Mystic Nights Videos

sources.title: Night Tide (1961) | Colorized Public Domain Psychological Horror with Dennis Hopper and Linda Lawson
sources.description:
Night Tide (1961) is an American psychological horror and mystery film written and directed by Curtis Harrington. This restored and colorized public domain classic brings new depth and visual life to a unique early entry in the indie horror genre. Combining elements of gothic romance, surrealist atmosphere, and slow-burn suspense, the film explores obsession, fear, and myth through the lens of seaside carnival life. Known for its dreamlike quality, Night Tide also features one of Dennis Hopper‚Äôs earliest starring roles, long before his breakout in Easy Rider.

Plot Summary:
The story follows Johnny Drake (Dennis Hopper), a young sailor on shore leave in Venice Beach, California. Lonely and searching for connection, he encounters Mora (Linda Lawson), a mysterious woman who performs as a mermaid in a sideshow attraction. Johnny is immediately drawn to her beauty and quiet intensity, but soon learns that Mora hides troubling secrets.

Mora is under the care of Captain Murdock (Gavin Muir), who warns Johnny that she is cursed. According to him, Mora is descended from a race of sirens who lure men to their deaths. Though Johnny dismisses this as myth, he cannot ignore the string of mysterious drownings connected to Mora. As he becomes more involved, Johnny struggles to separate reality from delusion, desire from danger. The film unfolds with eerie carnival backdrops, shadowy nightscapes, and a sense of impending tragedy that blurs the line between supernatural horror and psychological breakdown.

Cast and Crew:
‚Ä¢ Director: Curtis Harrington
‚Ä¢ Producer: Aram Kantarian
‚Ä¢ Writer: Curtis Harrington
‚Ä¢ Music: David Raksin
‚Ä¢ Cinematography: Vilis Lapenieks

Starring:
‚Ä¢ Dennis Hopper as Johnny Drake
‚Ä¢ Linda Lawson as Mora
‚Ä¢ Gavin Muir as Captain Murdock
‚Ä¢ Marjorie Eaton as Madame Romanovitch
‚Ä¢ Luana Anders as Ellen

Film Significance:
Night Tide is a hallmark of low-budget, atmospheric filmmaking. It captures early 1960s independent cinema with a haunting style influenced by European surrealism and American noir. The film balances psychological tension with folklore, echoing the postwar fascination with identity, alienation, and the subconscious. Its seaside setting and eerie carnival imagery place it among the more unusual horror films of its time, diverging from the monster-driven narratives of the era.

Dennis Hopper‚Äôs performance, subdued and vulnerable, adds historical importance. This was one of his earliest major roles, showing the sensitivity and intensity that would later define his career. Curtis Harrington, part of the avant-garde scene and a friend of filmmakers like Kenneth Anger, demonstrates here his unique ability to blend horror with arthouse aesthetics. Though obscure for decades, Night Tide has been rediscovered as a cult classic, valued for its dreamlike narrative, atmospheric visuals, and blend of romance and horror.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Night Tide remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for today‚Äôs viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1961 release was in black and white, reinforcing the film‚Äôs surreal and noir-inspired mood. While visually striking, many modern viewers overlook monochrome films. This colorized edition highlights the carnival‚Äôs unsettling lights, the ocean‚Äôs eerie depths, and the emotional weight of Dennis Hopper‚Äôs performance. By updating its visual appeal, we preserve its haunting atmosphere while making it more accessible to contemporary audiences.

Subscribe and Explore More Classics:

We upload restored and colorized films from the Golden Age of cinema through the rise of independent filmmaking. From forgotten B-movies to culturally significant works, our collection ensures these treasures remain discoverable, engaging, and preserved for audiences in the USA, Europe, and worldwide.

sources.title: Night Tide (1961) Dennis Hopper, Linda Lawson | Horror, Romance | Movie, subtitles
sources.description:
Temptress from the sea...loving...killing!
A young sailor falls in love with a mysterious woman performing as a mermaid at the local carnival. He soon comes to suspect the girl might be a real mermaid who draws men to watery deaths during the full moon.

Director & Writer: Curtis Harrington
Stars: Dennis Hopper, Linda Lawson, Gavin Muir,  Luana Anders
Genres: Drama, Horror, Romance, Thriller
Budget: $25,000

This video is subtitled in more than 30 languages. Click on ‚öôÔ∏è and choose subtitles and/or audio tracks.
